subject: Philosophy
title: Rationalism vs. Empiricism
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Rationalism vs. Empiricism.

hook.text: Where does knowledge come from â€” your mind or your senses? Philosophers split into two camps.

buildup.text: Rationalists like Descartes said reason alone reveals truth. Math proves this daily.

discovery.text: Empiricists like Locke said the mind starts blank. All knowledge enters through experience.

twist.text: Kant broke the deadlock. He argued the mind shapes experience, so both sides were half right.

climax.text: We use reason to organize what our senses deliver. Neither alone gives the full picture.

punchline.text: The mind and the senses need each other.

quiz.question: Who argued that the mind shapes our experience of the world?
